channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The world is changing fast—but there is reason for optimism
item.description: As Europe responds to American tariffs, policymakers and businesses must step up, embrace innovation and play a part in creating the European Dream.

item.title: Tourist Submarine Sinks Off Egypt’s Red Sea Coast
item.description: The vessel was said to be carrying more than 40 tourists near the Red Sea resort of Hurghada.

item.title: Tesla is suing to open dealerships in Wisconsin, the state where Elon Musk is spending heavily to influence judicial elections
item.description: State law currently forbids it from opening dealerships there.

item.title: Auto Tariff Sticker Shock
item.description: President Trump’s vow to hit the global automotive industry with new duties risks raising inflation and inflaming trade-war tensions.

item.title: AI search engine Perplexity wants to create the next great shopping experience. It believes a small startup can help
item.description: The company is working with the startup Firmly.ai to help make it easy for any brand, big or small, to start selling goods directly through its servic...

item.title: E.P.A. Offers a Way to Avoid Clean-Air Rules: Send an Email
item.description: Invoking an obscure provision, it said power plants and others could write to ask for exemptions to mercury, arsenic and other restrictions and that “...

item.title: Brazen Hypocrisy Enters the Signal Group Chat
item.description: In Trump World, the rules apply only to other people.

item.title: From outcast to on-track: How M&S found a culture to turn a crumbling business around
item.description: M&S is enjoying four years of growth under the leadership of Archie Norman and Stuart Machin however there is still much more to do and they are not r...

item.title: Meta’s not the only company with a ‘block list’—but experts reveal there are ways to escape the dreaded ‘do not hire’ label
item.description: Workplace experts say employer ‘block lists’ are common, especially in tech. Being an ‘activist’ or even quitting at the wrong time could quietly get ...

item.title: For John Green, It’s Tuberculosis All the Way Down
item.description: The best-selling author “got a little emotional” while talking with The Times about the world’s deadliest infectious disease. Listen to the conversati...

item.title: ‘View From the Floor’: What I Learned From Going on ‘Maury’
item.description: After appearing on “Maury” 25 years ago, a singer without legs questions why she’s seen as inspirational in “View From the Floor.”

item.title: South Sudan’s Vice President Machar Arrested, Party Says
item.description: The United Nations warned that the detention of Vice President Riek Machar threatens to push the world’s youngest country back into civil war.

item.title: Tourist Submarine Sinks Off Egypt’s Red Sea Coast
item.description: The vessel was said to be carrying more than 40 tourists near the Red Sea resort of Hurghada.
